lead_paragraph: Gordon Gee, the new president at Ohio State University, told reporters that college athletics had to be fixed at the national level and that he would have “zero tolerance” for player misbehavior at Ohio State. When he was chancellor at Vanderbilt, Gee disbanded the athletic department because he contended sports had become too separate from the rest of the university. He said yesterday that he did not believe the approach would work at Ohio State, but added, “It’s very important for us to set a very high standard for ourselves.”.
